definitions.definition: a way of discovering, by questions or practical activities, what someone knows, or what someone or something can do or is like:
examples: The class are doing/having a spelling test today.

definitions.definition: a medical examination of part of your body in order to find out how healthy it is or what is happening with it:
an act of using something to find out if it is working correctly or how effective it is:
examples: The new missiles are currently undergoing tests.

definitions.definition: a situation that shows how good something is:
examples: Driving on that icy road was a real test of my skill.
Australia won the test by 197 runs.

definitions.definition: to do something in order to discover if something is safe, works correctly, etc., or if something is present:
examples: The manufacturers are currently testing the new engine.

definitions.definition: to give someone a set of questions, in order to measure their knowledge or ability:
examples: Will you test me on the chemistry I've been learning?

definitions.definition: If a situation tests someone, it proves how good, strong, etc. they are:
examples: That lecture really tested my powers of endurance, it was so boring.

definitions.definition: to do a medical examination of part of someone's body or of a particular physical ability
